p: The magnitude of transmission rate varies with time and corresponds to time-varying contacts between susceptible and infected hosts [ 36]. Thus, environmental changes lead wildlife hosts to a critical density threshold, below which the virus cannot invade ( S7 Fig) [ 34, 37]. In addition, a decreased carrying capacity is associated with loss of farmland area over time ( Fig 4). This moves hantavirus dynamics into an environmentally forced regime with large fluctuations in infection rate.
